The following is a descriptive document of the open source datasets that might be of use for the USF summer institute.

# <ins> On Police shootings/killings </ins>

### Washington Post Data - police shootings
Source https://github.com/washingtonpost/data-police-shootings

Raw data: `wpdata`
Filtered by states of test cities: `t_wpdata`

To filter by test cities:
```{r eval=FALSE, include=TRUE}
data(t_wpdata)
sf_wpdata <- t_wpdata %>% filter(city == "San Francisco")
ch_wpata <- t_wpdata %>% filter(city == "Chicago")
more_wpdata <- t_wpdata %>% filter(city == "Baltimore")
nyc_wpdata <- t_wpdata %>% filter(city == "New York")
dt_wpdata <- t_wpdata %>% filter(city == "Detroit")
kcmo_wpdata <- t_wpdata %>% filter(city == "Kansas City")
```


```{r echo=TRUE}
data(t_wpdata)
plot(t_wpdata$geometry)
```


### Fatal Encounters
Source https://fatalencounters.org/spreadsheets/

Raw data: `encounters`
Filtered by states of test cities: `t_encounters`

To filter by test cities:
```{r eval=FALSE, include=TRUE}
data(t_encounters)
sf_encounters <- t_encounters %>% filter(city_death == "San Francisco")
ch_encounters <- t_encounters %>% filter(city_death == "Chicago")
more_encounters <- t_encounters %>% filter(city_death == "Baltimore")
nyc_encounters <- t_encounters %>% filter(city_death == "New York")
dt_encounters <- t_encounters %>% filter(city_death == "Detroit")
kcmo_encounters <- t_encounters %>% filter(city_death == "Kansas City")
```

```{r echo=TRUE}
data(t_encounters)
plot(t_encounters$geometry)
```

### Mapping Police Violence
Source: https://mappingpoliceviolence.org/aboutthedata

Whole data set: `mpv`


- Worksheet 1 "2013-2020 Police Killings": `mpv_polkill`
Filter by states: `t_mpv_polkill`
Geocoded data including intersections (created with ArcGIS Pro 10)

To filter by test cities
```{r eval=FALSE, include=TRUE}
sf_mpv_polkill <- t_mpv_polkill %>% filter(City == "San Francisco")
ch_mpv_polkill <- t_mpv_polkill %>% filter(City == "Chicago")
more_mpv_polkill <- t_mpv_polkill %>% filter(City == "Baltimore")
nyc_mpv_polkill <- t_mpv_polkill %>% filter(City == "New York")
dt_mpv_polkill <- t_mpv_polkill %>% filter(City == "Detroit")
kcmo_mpv_polkill <- t_mpv_polkill %>% filter(City == "Kansas City")
```


```{r echo=TRUE}
data(t_mpv_polkill)
plot(t_mpv_polkill$geometry)
```


- Worksheet 2 "2013-2020 Killings by PD" : `mpv_polkillbypd`
Filter by states and city: `t_mpv_polkillbypd`
Chart by city (only for San Francisco, Baltimore, New York, and Detroit)

```{r echo=TRUE}
knitr::kable(head(t_mpv_killbypd %>% filter(City == "San Francisco")))
```


- Worksheet 3 "2013-2020 Killings by State": `mpv_polkillbypd`
Filter by states: `t_mpv_polkillbypd`
```{r echo=FALSE}
knitr::kable(t_mpv_polkillbypd)
```

- Worksheet 4 "Police Killings of Black Men"
```{r echo=FALSE}
data(mpv_polkilbm)
colnames(mpv_polkilbm)
```

# <ins> Drawing the Black Box </ins>

## <ins> Property data </ins>

Most cities have property data available you can download for free: "Property Vaulation and Assessment Data". 

### NYC Real Estate Assessment Property data.
Built with the Department of Finance values.
Source: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/City-Government/Property-Valuation-and-Assessment-Data/yjxr-fw8i

### MassGIS - MA Interactive Property Map
Datasets per city ready for download.
Source: https://massgis.maps.arcgis.com/apps/OnePane/basicviewer/index.html?appid=47689963e7bb4007961676ad9fc56ae9

### LA County Open Data Initiative
Property related data: https://data.lacounty.gov/browse?category=Property%2FPlanning&utf8=%E2%9C%93

### Zillow
Source: https://www.zillow.com/research/data/

"Zillow publishes top-tier ZHVI (typical value for homes within the 65th to 95th percentile range for a given region) and bottom-tier ZHVI (typical value for homes that fall within the 5th to 35th percentile range for a given region)."

ZHVI All Homes - Top tier time series $ (Metro and US)
```{r echo=FALSE}
data(zhvi_toptier)
kbl(head(zhvi_toptier[, 1:6]))
```

..

ZHVI All Homes - Bottom tier time series $ (Metro and US)
```{r echo=FALSE}
data(zhvi_bottomtier)
kbl(head(zhvi_bottomtier[, 1:6]))
```
